summary: This document details an interview with Anthony Figueroa conducted by Detective Paul Byrne and Special Agent Amanda Young regarding his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. Figueroa discusses his relationship with a woman who worked for Epstein and his involvement in recruiting other girls for Epstein, as well as his observations about their activities.

persons.name: Anthony Figueroa

persons.context: Young conducted the interview with Figueroa.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the central figure in the allegations and is mentioned multiple times in relation to his activities and interactions with Figueroa.

connections.description: Figueroa met Maxwell a few times and discussed her activities with Epstein.
Figueroa was involved in recruiting girls for Epstein, who was paying him for this service.
Byrne is a detective interviewing Figueroa about his knowledge of Epstein and Maxwell.
Young is a special agent interviewing Figueroa regarding his past interactions with Epstein.

events.title: Interview of Anthony Figueroa
events.description: Figueroa was interviewed about his past interactions with Epstein and Maxwell, including recruiting girls for Epstein.

keyFacts: Anthony Figueroa was deposed by Brad Edwards for a lawsuit related to Ghislaine Maxwell approximately five years prior to the interview.
Figueroa was involved in recruiting girls for Jeffrey Epstein, receiving $200 for each girl he brought to him.
Figueroa's girlfriend worked as a traveling massage therapist for Epstein and would often travel with him.
Figueroa had limited interactions with Maxwell but was aware of her involvement in recruiting girls for Epstein.
Figueroa mentioned that Epstein would ask him to ensure the girls were 18 years old and not overweight.
